meanings.definition: The ability of a material to function in a specific application with an appropriate host response in a specific environment.
meanings.sent1: The biocompatibilities of the new implant were tested extensively before being used in patients.
meanings.sent2: Doctors consider the biocompatibilities of different materials when choosing the best option for medical devices.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the robot's biocompatibilities were so good, it could almost pass for a real human!
meanings.sent4: The biocompatibilities of the synthetic skin were so remarkable that it seamlessly blended with the natural tissue.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the biocompatibilities of various substances is crucial for developing safe medical treatments.

meanings.definition: The quality of being compatible with living tissue or a living system.
meanings.sent1: The biocompatibilities of the new material made it ideal for use in organ transplants.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are constantly striving to improve the biocompatibilities of medical devices to reduce the risk of rejection.
meanings.sent3: The chef humorously compared the dish's biocompatibilities with the taste buds of his customers.
meanings.sent4: Her warm personality had a biocompatibilities that made everyone feel comfortable and at ease around her.
meanings.sent5: The biocompatibilities of the plant with its environment allowed it to thrive in harsh conditions.
